Addon.name: Addon
Addon.description:
Addon module contains the components, routes and utils for generating docs
application.

App.name: App
App.description:
Fountainhead's routes are automatically mounted to the consuming application's
router through an `instance-initializer`. We're currently directly importing
the consuming application's router by declaring this initializer in the `/app`
directory instead of the `/addon` directory.

Blueprints.name: Blueprints
Blueprints.description:
When an addon has an `index.js` file under `/blueprints/ADDON_NAME`, Ember
CLI will call the hooks defined there. We use this to handle anything that
needs to be updated in the consuming application only once during the addon
setup.

Lib.name: Lib
Lib.description:
Modules in the `./lib` directory handle generating -> parsing -> decorating ->
saving all data required for Fountainhead. Fountainhead is backed by REST APIs
rather than static file generation. Each module, class and file are saved as
JSON fetched on demand by the client.

See this module for details/classes on the Node data generation application.
See below for a high level overview of the flow of the application through
the related modules.

## Lib Classes Overview:

#### Validation && Preparation
- `index.js`: Primary entry point to Node application
- `decorate-config`: Validate and merge addon configs, package JSON and default configs
- `create-dirs`: Create directories required for JSON files

#### Generation && Decoration
- `generate-fountainhead-data`: Coordinates parsing raw YUIDoc using `data-types` modules
- `data-types/generate-modules`: Parse && decorate raw modules data
- `data-types/generate-classes`: Parse && decorate raw class && class items data
- `data-types/generate-file`: Parse && decorate source files
- `parse-markdown`: Called for every description, parses markdown contents to HTML

FountainHead.Class.Header.name: FountainHead.Class.Header
FountainHead.Class.Header.description:
Docs Page class header. Contains class name with a link to source file for
class.

FountainHead.Class.ClassItem.name: FountainHead.Class.ClassItem
FountainHead.Class.ClassItem.description: Individual class property or method documentation item

FountainHeadClass.ItemsContainer.name: FountainHeadClass.ItemsContainer
FountainHeadClass.ItemsContainer.description:
Tab container for the class' documentation items. Component handles running
a controlled instance of `core-tabs` by tracking `activeTab` internally and
passing `tabsChanged` to the `core-tabs` instance.

The active tab is reset to the index panel anytime that the `name` (of the
class) changes.

FountainHead.Class.Meta.name: FountainHead.Class.Meta
FountainHead.Class.Meta.description:
Creates meta information for a documentation class.

TODO: Document which YUIDoc tags generate what meta data

FountainHead.Docs.name: FountainHead.Docs
FountainHead.Docs.description:
Fountainhead `/doc` page component serves as the wrapping template for all of
Fountainhead. The `outlet` for the route is yielded by this component, which
is how we use components to handle rendering all of our markup, even with
subroutes.

Because we want the default setup of Fountainhead to look like it's own app
we render everything in a `fh-page-in-page-wrapper` wrapper which is position
fixed to cover the entire screen. This allows us to have our own header and
footer even if a consuming application has one in their `application.hbs`
template.

The `fountainhead` service is the primary store for the addon and handles
fetching the meta data for the docs.

FountainHead.Module.name: FountainHead.Module
FountainHead.Module.description:
Fountainhead `/doc/module` page component
There's nothing here yet.

FountainHead.Docs.Sidebar.name: FountainHead.Docs.Sidebar
FountainHead.Docs.Sidebar.description:
Wrapper component for the sidebar components. Expects the entire docs meta
object.

CrossLink.name: CrossLink
CrossLink.description:
Use a `cross-link` component to handle cross referencing another documentation
item in your application. Internally the component handles creating a `link-to`
using the passed properties.

Property | Description
--- | ---
`text` | Inner HTML for link
`class` | Documentation class to link to
`module` | Documentation module to link to
`item` | Specific documentation item to link to, appended as a query param

#### Examples:
Generate a link to module 'YourModule'
```glimmer
{{cross-link module='YourModule'}}
```

Generate a link to class 'YourClass'
```glimmer
{{cross-link class='YourClass'}}
```

Generate a link to 'someMethod' on 'YourClass'
```glimmer
{{cross-link class='YourClass' item='someMethod'}}
```

*NOTE* Component requires either a `class` or `module` passed in.
An `item` may be passed to link to a specific class item.

FountainHead.Shared.Alert.name: FountainHead.Shared.Alert
FountainHead.Shared.Alert.description: Fountainhead Alert Component copied from Radical

FountainHead.Shared.Button.name: FountainHead.Shared.Button
FountainHead.Shared.Button.description:
Fountainhead button component pulled from `ember-radical` addon.
TODO: One day use nested addons, _trepidation_

FountainHead.Header.name: FountainHead.Header
FountainHead.Header.description:
The landing message is rendered on the `/docs/index` route and shows either a
helpful getting started or docs related message depending on if the user has
generated docs or not. We know by passing in the meta information in the
`/docs/index` template

FountainHead.Docs.Github.name: FountainHead.Docs.Github
FountainHead.Docs.Github.description: Github octocat logo in the top right corner.

Fountainhead.RuntimeDescription.name: Fountainhead.RuntimeDescription
Fountainhead.RuntimeDescription.description:
Generates a description during runtime by using HTMLBars to compile any
string to a partial. This allows us to create descriptions from JSON
responses with components inside of them.

TODO: Name partials by class+type+name for re-use

CoreTabs.Content.name: CoreTabs.Content
CoreTabs.Content.description:
This component is yielded by the `core-tabs` component. The `activeId` and
actions `registerTab` and `updateTab` are privately bound for internal use.

On init each tab will register itself with the `core-tabs` wrapping container,
passing all its data. The `core-tabs` container uses this to build out the
tab buttons.

```handlebars
{{#core-tabs defaultTab="dumpsterShrimp" as |components|}}
  {{#components.content label="Shrimp" elementId="dumpsterShrimp" tabDataTest="a-nifty-tab-button"}}
    BRINGO! There's some pretty good lil' shrimpers in here, lets check it out.
  {{/components.content}}
{{/core-tabs}}
```

Configuration | Type | Default | Description
--- | --- | --- | ---
`label` | string | null | Text label of the tab button for this panel
`elementId` | string | null | Set a specific id for this component when using container `defaultTab`
`tabDataTest` | string | null | `data-test` for the tab button

CoreTabs.name: CoreTabs
CoreTabs.description:
A++ Accessible tabs. The `core-tabs` component is the parent container for
a given set of tabs and handles managing the active state of the tabs and tab
panels. The `core-tabs` component yields a `content` contextual component
inside of the `components` hash.

#### Usage

```handlebars
{{#core-tabs as |components|}}
  {{#components.content label="Delgrango's"}}
    This is my favorite resaurant at the marinara, name of Delgrango's
  {{/components.content}}
  {{#components.content label="Fresh Water"}}
    Boy I sure did work up a thirst after eating all them shramps. Time to
    wash it down with a cool glass of marina water.
  {{/components.content}}
{{/core-tabs}}
```

You can include any number of `components.content` contextual components.
_(However keep in mind that adding too many `content` components may result in
the tab labels becoming unreadable depending on the space alotted for
displaying them.)_

You can also specify a default tab by setting the `defaultTab` parameter to
match one of content components' HTML id property:

```handlebars
{{#core-tabs defaultTab="shrimpers" as |components|}}
  {{#components.content label="Shrimp" elementId="shrimpers"}}
    BRINGO! There's some pretty good lil' shrimpers in here, lets check it out.
  {{/components.content}}
  {{#components.content label="Delgrango's"}}
    This is my favorite resaurant at the marinara, name of Delgrango's
  {{/components.content}}
{{/core-tabs}}
```

### Controlled Tabs
If you need to programatically open tabs within your application you can
create a controlled instance of `core-tabs` by specifying the `activeId` for
the component. This means that you need to track the `activeId` in a parent
component or service and pass it down into the controlled tab instance. To do
this pass an `onChange` closure into the component. It will be called with
the `elementId` of the selected tab any time a user changes tabs.

TODO: Template && JS Examples

Configuration | Type | Default | Description
--- | --- | ---
`activeId` | string | null | The `elementId` of the tab that should be opened
`buttonStyle` | boolean | true | Set to false for tab buttons without primary background-color
`defaultTab` | string | null | Tab to render shown by default
`onChange` | function | null | Optional closure that will be called when any tab is opened
`scrollOnClick` | boolean | false | Set to true to scroll page to top on tab click
`scrollTarget` | jQuery selector | 'body, html' | Specify scroll animation target

### A++ Accessibility
- Tabs have `aria-controls` set to the `elementId` of the `tabpanel` they show.
- Tabs have `role=tab` for role identification
- Tabs are instances of `core-button` for keyboard access
- Show/hide of tabs and panels are managed through `aria-hidden` attr

### Feature Notes:
- The tab list is a flexbox container with flex-grow 1 for each tab. This auto
  magically grows the tabs to fill the entire width of tab container.

Docs.Classes.name: Docs.Classes
Docs.Classes.description: Route handles fetching data for an individual class.

Helper.Eq.name: Helper.Eq
Helper.Eq.description: Helper to compare two values to see if they are equal. Values must be of the same type.

params.name: args
params.description: Positional args passed to helper should be compared

Docs.Files.name: Docs.Files
Docs.Files.description: Route handles fetching data for a source file.

Docs.Modules.name: Docs.Modules
Docs.Modules.description: Route to be created for handling modules

FountainheadRoutes.name: FountainheadRoutes
FountainheadRoutes.description:
Automagically mount Fountainhead routes through an `instance-initializer`.

NOTE: this initializer needs to be in the `/app` directory so that the the
consuming application's router can be directly imported and manipulated.

TODO: See if we can use some kind of lookup to do this from within an
initializer in the `/addon` directory

EmberFountainhead.Index.name: EmberFountainhead.Index
EmberFountainhead.Index.description:
Fountainhead index blueprint is used to update the consuming application's
`.gitignore` to ignore the auto generated `vendor/feature-flags.js` file
created by `ember-radical`. This file is used to create global variables if
the consuming application has turned off JSUglify code stripping.

DataTypes.GenerateClasses.name: DataTypes.GenerateClasses
DataTypes.GenerateClasses.description:
Module handles decorating and compiling classes and their class items including:
- Compiling each class item to its class
- Creating an id for class and class src file
- Parsing class and class item descriptions markdown to HTML

return.description: Returns object: `{ classesMeta, classesDatas }` for saving

DataTypes.GenerateModules.name: DataTypes.GenerateModules
DataTypes.GenerateModules.description:
Handle parsing/decorating raw YUIDoc modules data including:
- Generate meta objects for each module that can be used for the sidebar nav
- Create an array of modules from YUIDoc object of modules for standard lib format
- Parse module markdown description to HTML

return.description: Returns object: `{ modulesMeta, modulesDatas }` for saving

DataTypes.GenerateSrcFile.name: DataTypes.GenerateSrcFile
DataTypes.GenerateSrcFile.description: Handle syntax highlighting and creating meta information for a src file

createDirs.name: createDirs
createDirs.description: Handle creating output directories for Fountainhead data.

decorateConfig.name: decorateConfig
decorateConfig.description:
Handle adding default values to config and validating required properties
are present

return.description: Fully decorated and validated project configuration file

generateFountainheadData.name: generateFountainheadData
generateFountainheadData.description:
This module handles coordinating parsing/reading/saving all of the individual
Fountainhead data files after the configs have been validated and the raw
YUIDoc data has been generated.

Module should:
- create and populate `docsMeta` that will be saved as `meta.json`
- generate decorated modules files
- generate decorated class files
- generate decorated src file files

NOTE: When switching doc generation from an executable to a function call
all file operations had to be changed to a synchronous operation b/c the ember
command finishes before the async file operations are complete and the contents
are not written to file. This can be switched back to an async method by
assembling and returning a promise.all for all async file calls

Index.name: Index
Index.description:
Fountainhead documentation data generation lib entry. Configuration is set
through `fountainhead.js` file. (TODO: Add default configs to decorate-config)
class and link.

The entry handles:
1. Safe require of `package.json` && `fountainhead.js` files for configs
2. Decoration && validation of project configs
3. Generation of raw YUIDoc JSON through YUIDoc module directly
4. Decoration of raw data in `generate-fountainhead-data` module.

The primary module is the `generate-fountainhead-data` which handles all of
the decoration and file creation required for Fountainhead.

return.description: HTML string parsed from passed markdown

item in init. Id is the `itemtype_name` and is used to scroll to the

classitems.description:
Array of *ALL* items for this class. Used to find the type when an item is
specified in a query param.

classitems.description: This class' array of event documentation items.
classitems.name: event

classitems.description:
Item query param passed down from controller. When this property is present,
or changes handle scrolling to the item. When the specified doc class is
the same but the item query param is different the model hooks will not be
called, so we need to handle scrolling to the item when it changes.
classitems.name: item

classitems.description: This class' array of method documentation items.
classitems.name: method

classitems.description:
Name of the class. Is checked in `didUpdateAttrs` to know if the tabs
should be reset to the index panel
classitems.name: name

classitems.description: This class' array of property documentation items.
classitems.name: property

classitems.description:
The currently active tab. This is controlled by this component to allow
us to change the tab whenever a documentation item is clicked in the index
panel.
classitems.name: activeTab

classitems.description:
The panel that that the tabs should render on creation. The tabs component
tracks this separately and it needs to be updated separately when a class
page is loaded with an item query parameter.
classitems.name: defaultTab

classitems.description:
Internal method to handle selecting a tab panel and then scrolling to an
item in that panel.

Method will:
- Change to the panel matching the doc item type
- Scroll to that item using the itemtype and name to construct the DOM id
classitems.name: _scrollToItem

classitems.description:
Handles finding the classitem model using the `item` query param value.
If a classitem is found, initiate a scroll.
classitems.name: _scrollToQueryParamItem

params.name: item
params.description: The item query param identifying which classitem to scroll to

classitems.description:
Handle resetting tabs container to the index panel any time that this
component's attrs update. The only props passed in to this component are
the class items for the container, so we know if they change in any way
that this is the right time to update the tabs panel.

NOTE: GUESS WHAT! This hook doens't only get called when passed props
change! There is some crazy behavior where this hook will get called ONCE
and only ONCE when an internal property changes after the props for this
component has changed. Super weird. For now we're 'fixing' it by also
passing in the class name and using that as a check to reset the `activeTab`
classitems.name: didUpdateAttrs
init

classitems.description:
Action bound to each documentation item in the index panel. Clicking any
item will trigger this with the documentation item as an argument. Use
the passed doc item to internally call
{{cross-link class='FountainHeadClass.ItemsContainer' item='_scrollToItem'}}
to scroll to clicked item.
classitems.name: goToItem

classitems.description:
Closure action passed into the tab component. This action is called
whenever a tab is clicked with the id of the tab. Use this to update the
controlling `activeTab` property for the tabs DDAU style.
classitems.name: tabsChanged

params.name: tab
params.description: Backing object for a given tab

props.name: elementId
props.description: The id of the tab, controls current tab displayed

classitems.description:
The access property is set by using either of the tags:
- `@private`
- `@public`

The value for access matches the tag used
classitems.name: access

classitems.description:
The value property is set by using the `@extends` tag. Any class used in
an extends tag will be linked to.
classitems.name: extends

classitems.description:
The file property matches where the documentation for a class is declared
in the source files. It is set automatically.
classitems.name: file

classitems.description:
The module property is set by using the `@module` tag. Any module used in
a module tag will be linked to.
classitems.name: module

classitems.description:
The line property matches the line where documentation for a class is
declared in the source files. It is set automatically.
classitems.name: line

classitems.description:
scrFile id is set by the data scripts. It is a snake case version of the
file path and should be used for calling for the file
classitems.name: srcFileId

classitems.description:
The submodule property is set by using the `@submodule` tag. Any submodule
used in a submodule tag will be linked to.
classitems.name: submodule

classitems.description:
The uses array is set by using one or more `@uses` tags. Any class used in
a uses tag will be linked to.
classitems.name: uses

classitems.description: Class model content.

item

Handle nulling out properties `submodules` and `classes` if they don't have
any keys.
classitems.name: didReceiveAttrs

classitems.description:
Fountainhead meta passed from service. Used to calculate `stringForAriaHidden`
to hide sidebar when there is no data.

Fountainhead meta is passed into the sidebar. When there is no data, then
we haven't run the documentation scripts yet, so we need to hide the sidebar
using aria-hidden. Convert presence of meta data to string of boolean that
can be used for aria-hidden
classitems.name: stringForAriaHidden

return.description:
Returns either string of `true` or `false` dependent on

Class item to cross link to.

otherwise default text is generated:

prevents the component from creating an invalid `link-to`.

Checks for a passed
{{cross-link class='Crosslink' item='text'}} and sets default
text if unspecified
classitems.name: init

classitems.description: Specify brand, component handles assigning correct css class

canDismiss

Contains optional action that is executed when the alert is dismissed.
This action will be executed before the alert is destroyed.

Computed css class bound to component. Handled by component to allow for

classitems.description: A++ accessibility. Tells a screen this component is an alert.

Static class names applied to the component that must always exist. This

classitems.description:
A set of dynamic classes whose output is bound to the associated values

classitems.description:
Allows for quick and easy dismissal of the alert. The alert is faded from
view, then totally removed from the DOM and the component instance is
destroyed.
classitems.name: _selfDestruct

classitems.description: Actions hash
classitems.name: actions

classitems.description: A proxy action for the selfDestruct method
classitems.name: dismiss

classitems.description: Pass a brand to have `btn-${brand}` class applied
classitems.name: brand

classitems.description:
Pass true to create a button that looks and behaves like a link. This is
useful for creating accessible interaction targets.
classitems.name: link

classitems.description:
Computed css class bound to component. Handled by component to allow for
flexibility in future updates to branding class names
classitems.name: brandClass

classitems.description:
ALLLLLLLLLLL the attributes you might need.
NOTE: `role` should not be bound here. You can set the role of a button
by passing an [ariaRole](http://emberjs.com/api/classes/Ember.Component.html#property_ariaRole) prop.
classitems.name: attributeBindings

classitems.description: Bind standard core classname for component: `core-button`
classitems.name: classNames

classitems.description: Handle binding brand and link related css class names
classitems.name: classNameBindings

classitems.description: Button DOM element
classitems.name: tagName

classitems.description: Include type button for usability.
classitems.name: type

classitems.description:
The `mouseDown` event is used for some utility/housekeeping methods because
we use the `click` event to pass in actions.

Handle setting the outline on this element to `none` because we know this
event is only triggered by actual mouse clicks. Keyboard events don't trigger
it, which is a convenient way to know we're good to hide the outline and
maintain usability for keyboard users. A++ accessibility!

Handle checking for a tagging category and if one exists, fire a tag.

If you need to override this event, be sure to call `this._super();`
classitems.name: mouseDown

classitems.description:
Repository URL from fountainhead configurations. If a URL has been specified
in the configs or the `package.json` this github logo will show with a link
to the repo
classitems.name: repository

classitems.description:
The content string that should be rendered. This string is passed to the
runtime compiler and registered as a partial if compilation is successful.
classitems.name: content

classitems.description: The string that should be converted to a partial
classitems.name: description

classitems.description:
If there is a parsing error during the template compilation the catch block
will set it as the `compilerError`. This parsing error is rendered for
easier debugging of invalid content.
classitems.name: compilerError

classitems.description: Name of generated partial that is used in the template.
classitems.name: partialName

classitems.description:
Looks through the passed-in template string and checks for action helpers;
when it finds some, it checks for the actions referenced and registers no-ops
for them on this component's context so that the application doesn't explode
when trying to reference a non-existent action.
classitems.name: _checkActionRefs

params.name: templateString
params.description: The template string to run the check for action matches on

classitems.description:
Grabs the input from the parent instance's code editor, compiles it into a
real-live HTMLBars template, registers it on the container as a partial
and makes it available as output for the preview component's template to
render.

New partials are created for every change, using a date string as the
partial name to avoid collisions.

TODO: Use lookup partial names that can be mapped and retrieved instead of
making new ones each time
classitems.name: _generateDescription

classitems.description:
On init we map the passed `contextActions` to real actions in this
component's actions hash to ensure they're available at compile time.

classitems.description:
Whenever attrs are received fire the `_generateDescription` method to
generate a partial that will be rendered.

Allow direct binding of `data-test` attributes so that icons can be

classitems.description:
The id of the currently active tab in the scope of the core-tabs component.
This is provided privately in the `core-tabs` yield hash.
classitems.name: activeId

classitems.description:
Whether this tab should be hidden from view. Useful for situations where
a tab needs to exist in a particular place in the tab ordering but may
not have the data it needs to display information at the time when
`registerTab` is invoked. This allows you to make sure your tab can be
hidden while preserving its place in the list.

classitems.description: Aria role `tabpanel` is bound for A++ accessibility.
classitems.name: ariaRole

classitems.description:
Bound attributes:
- `data-test`: for precise testing identification
- `_hidden`: to hide this tab if it is not selected or if prop hidden is true
classitems.name: attributeBindings

classitems.description: Class names: `tabs-content`
classitems.name: classNames

classitems.description:
Computed `_hidden` accounts for whether the tab is selected (by checking
`activeId`) && if this tab has been flagged to be hidden with property
`hidden`
classitems.name: _hidden

return.description: String of true/false for use with `aria-hidden` binding

classitems.description:
The button label text of this tab. This will be passed up via a closure
action to the containing `core-tabs` component.
classitems.name: label

classitems.description:
Use this attribute to place a custom data-test attribute on the tab button
for this tab. This will allow easier, specific/direct targeting of clicking
this tab in automated testing.
classitems.name: tabDataTest

classitems.description:
Handle registering with the tabs container on int by firing `registerTab`
closure action with this tab's data.
classitems.name: init

classitems.description:
Actions Up: When something changes in this component we need to let the
container tabs know by firing the `updateTab` closure action with this
tabs changed data.

_(Currently the only change we're notifying on is the `hidden` prop)_
classitems.name: didUpdateAttrs

classitems.description:
The elementId of the currently opened tab. This determines which tab is active and
which tab's content to display. If this is empty, no tabs are open.
classitems.name: activeId

classitems.description: Pass false to use tab style without primary color tabs.
classitems.name: buttonStyle

classitems.description:
The optional elementId of the tab that should be shown by default. This is
useful for cases where the user has come into a page and is expecting one
of the tabs to be shown by default.
classitems.name: defaultTab

classitems.description:
Optional closure action that will be called whenever a tab is opened with
the id of that tab. Use this to create a controlled tabs instance.
classitems.name: onChange

classitems.description:
Whether the page should scroll the tab context back to the top when one of
the tabs is clicked. This can be a nice convenience for usabilitee.
classitems.name: scrollOnClick

classitems.description:
What the target of the `scrollOnClick` behavior should be. By default,
the entire page/body scrolls, however if this instance of `core-tabs` is
contained within a modal or some other scrollable sub-container, it may
be more desirable to execute a scroll against that instead of the entire
page. Simply pass a standard jQuery-like selector in as a string.
classitems.name: scrollTarget

classitems.description:
Bound attributes:
- `data-test`: for precise testing identification
classitems.name: attributeBindings

classitems.description: Class names: `core-tabs`
classitems.name: classNames

classitems.description:
List of tabs to display. This is iterated through in the template to
rendered the buttons that are used to change tabs.
classitems.name: tabList

classitems.description:
Internal method that can be used with a `run.once` call to only add new tabs
once per run loop. Simply iterates through `_tabsToCreate` and pushes them
into the `tabList`. This is needed to prevent multiple renders in a single
run loop when all of the `content` subcomponents register themselves with
the container during init.
classitems.name: _createTabsList

classitems.description:
When the component initializes, we set the `tabList` property to an array.
This prevents multiple instances of core-tabs on a given page from
inheriting the same tabList array through prototype inheritance.
classitems.name: init

classitems.description:
Action to show a tab. Set `activeId` to the passed elementId. `activeId`
is passed down to children content components
classitems.name: showTab

params.name: elementId
params.description: HTML id of the tab to show

classitems.description:
Closure action passed to content subcomponents that is called on init.
Each child tab will register itself with this container. To ensure the
tabList is only updated once per render, we proxy new tabs to the
`_tabsToCreate` array and then push all of them to `tabList` using a
`run.once` call to `_createTabsList`
classitems.name: registerTab

params.name: tab
params.description: Object model of tab to be registered

classitems.description:
Closure action passed to content subcomponents that is called whenever
a tab has updated in a way this container needs to know of. Currently
this is only when a tab's `hidden` status changes.
classitems.name: updateTab

props.name: elementId
props.description: HTML id of tab to update

classitems.description: Item query param is available for scrolling to a doc item.
classitems.name: item

classitems.description: Fetches class' JSON at: `${this.get('fountainhead.apiNamespace')}/classes/${params.class_id}.json`
classitems.name: model

props.name: class_id
props.description: Name of this class, use to fetch data

classitems.description:
We don't want the class `item` query param to be sticky. If it is, then you
can end up pre-scrolled to some previously crosslinked item when returning
to a class.

The `resetController` hook is called anytime a route's model changes or the
route is exited, and is the recommended time to reset query param values on
a controller.
classitems.name: resetController

classitems.description:
Reset page scroll on any transition. Note that Fountainhead is inside of
a fake page, so we scroll that instead of the body
classitems.name: didTransition

classitems.description: Fetches file's JSON at: `${this.get('fountainhead.apiNamespace')}/files/${params.file_id}.json`
classitems.name: model

props.name: file_id
props.description: Name of this class, use to fetch data

classitems.description:
Reset page scroll on any transition. Note that Fountainhead is inside of
a fake page, so we scroll that instead of the body
classitems.name: didTransition

classitems.description: Fetches modules's JSON at: `${this.get('fountainhead.apiNamespace')}/modules/${params.file_id}.json`
classitems.name: model

props.name: module_id
props.description: Name of this class, use to fetch data

classitems.description:
Reset page scroll on any transition. Note that Fountainhead is inside of
a fake page, so we scroll that instead of the body
classitems.name: didTransition

classitems.description:
All Fountainhead API requests are prefixed with this namespace. If you
export your docs JSON files to a non-default location, or your application
is served under a namespace you can overwrite this property to match your
endpoint's root url namespace.
classitems.name: apiNamespace

classitems.description:
Documentation meta fetched from `/meta.json`. Contains high level map
of modules and classes available in documentation. Used for sidebar and
mapping item and return types.
This property is initialized to null so that the sidebar has an explicit
value to bind aria-hidden to. When there is no meta, there is no sidebar.
classitems.name: meta

classitems.description:
Flag used by docs route to show getting started instructions if the call for
documentation meta fails.
classitems.name: metaError

classitems.description:
When this service is loaded, handle fetching documentation meta data that
drives the sidebar && header. If there is an error we know tha we haven't
generated documentation yet. The docs template will pick up the error and
display the getting started instructions.

NOTE: the meta request needs to be wrapped in a `run.next` so that if a
consuming application needs to override the `apiNamespace` the meta call
is made with the new namespace. Without the run loop, attempting to set
the namespace will initialize this service and call for meta before the
namespace update is complete and the request will use the default `/docs`
namespace.
classitems.name: init

classitems.description:
Initialize route that is called by consuming Ember application
`Router` instance from the consuming application can directly mapped.
classitems.name: initialize

classitems.description:
After install of addon read in consuming application's gitignore. If there
isn't an entry for `vendor/feature-flags.js`, use node `fs` to append it.
classitems.name: afterInstall

classitems.description: Synchronous mkdir that handles creating a potentially nested directory
classitems.name: mkdirSync

params.name: dirPath
params.description: Directory path to create, can be nested

classitems.description:
Configuration entry should be an array of directory paths (YUIDoc can't
parse individual files unfortunately). The default entry is `app` when the
consumer is an application and `addon` when the consumer is an addon.
classitems.name: entry

classitems.description:
Configuration output path should be a directory path. The default is `public/docs`
when the consumer is an application and `tests/dummy/public/docs` when the
consumer is an addon (Outputting the docs to `/public` in an addon signals
Ember CLI to bundle your docs into any consuming applications `/public` dir
which is not the default behavior we want).
classitems.name: outputPath

classitems.description:
Call to handle saving data to a file. Requires a file path and data to save.
If data is not a string, it will be stringified
classitems.name: saveObjectToJSON

return.description: True for successful operation, false for failures

classitems.description:
The `docsMeta` object is the guide for the documentation data. It contains
descriptions of the project as well as arrays of module and class routing
information
classitems.name: docsMeta

classitems.description: Optional configs pulled from `fountainhead.js`
classitems.name: fountainheadConfig

classitems.description:
Package JSON for project. Used to populate project description if not
defined in `fountainhead.js` config.
classitems.name: packageJSON

classitems.description:
Raw YUIDoc JSON data generated using constructor exported by `yuidocjs`.
Call new with options from config to pass configs to YUIDoc and call `run`
to generate JSON
classitems.name: yuidocJSON

warnings.message: replacing incorrect tag: returns with return
replacing incorrect tag: returns with return
